backend_llm_notes: Claude Sonnet 4.5 via Cursor Agent Mode - Advanced reasoning and instruction following
original_prompt: Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha with the product and marketing team to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.

gutts.name: Meeting Context Retrieval
gutts.capability: Gather information about Project Alpha from available sources (docs, project management tools, status reports)
gutts.user_goal: Agenda based on actual project state, not generic template
gutts.evidence: Retrieved Project Alpha documents, status updates, and current state information

gutts.name: Stakeholder Role Identification
gutts.capability: Understand product team vs marketing team roles, responsibilities, and concerns
gutts.user_goal: Agenda addresses each group's specific needs and concerns
gutts.evidence: Identified product team (delivery, features) vs marketing (messaging, launch) perspectives

gutts.name: Agenda Structure Planning
gutts.capability: Create logical flow for review meeting (progress → confirmation → blockers → risks)
gutts.user_goal: Meeting has clear structure and logical progression
gutts.evidence: Structured agenda: 1) Progress review, 2) On-track confirmation, 3) Blocker discussion, 4) Risk assessment

gutts.name: Progress Review Items Generation
gutts.capability: List specific accomplishments, milestones completed, and metrics to review
gutts.user_goal: Concrete progress discussion points with evidence
gutts.evidence: Generated list of completed milestones, metrics (e.g., feature completion %), achievements

gutts.name: Blocker & Risk Identification
gutts.capability: Surface known issues, dependencies, blockers, and potential risks for discussion
gutts.evidence: Identified current blockers (e.g., API dependency) and risks (e.g., timeline pressure)

gutts.name: Time Allocation & Formatting
gutts.capability: Assign time to each agenda item and format for professional distribution
gutts.user_goal: Professional, well-structured agenda document ready to share
gutts.evidence: Time allocated per section (15min progress, 10min confirmation, 20min blockers, 15min risks), formatted document

notes: Generated by Claude Sonnet 4.5 - Matches reference decomposition of 6 GUTTs
